Adobe Product Community - 12547216","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/after-effects-discussions/html-panel-extension-cep11-breaks-scrolling-and-pointer-events-on-macos/td-p/12547216"}]

Based on my search results, I found information about Adobe CEP range input/slider issues:

## Adobe CEP Range Input/Slider Issues

"Range Slider is broken" is listed as a known issue in the official Adobe CEP Resources GitHub repository.

### Key Findings:

1. **Known CEP Limitation**: This appears to be a CEP limitation affecting draggable elements in CEP panels.

2. **Event Listener Limitations**: The standard range slider `input type="range"` will only take input and change as event listeners and does not respond to other events like mousedown, mouseup, etc.

3. **CEP 11 Issues on macOS**: Since upgrading to CEP 11 (> 18.2.1, >= 22.0.0), some developers encounter problems with pointer events and scrolling. Things work well for Windows, but on a MacOS machine, scrolling stopped working and mouse cursor doesn't change according to CSS rules.

4. **Draggable Elements Issues**: Adding `draggable="true"` doesn't seem to work on elements. There was a mention of this on the Known Issues but having the Chrome inspect window open (and following the instructions) doesn't make any difference.

### Potential Workarounds:

- Use only `input` and `change` event listeners for range sliders instead of mouse events
- Consider implementing a custom slider using JavaScript instead of the native HTML range input
- Check the [Adobe CEP Issues documentation](https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/CEP-Resources/blob/master/CEP_11.x/Documentation/Issues.md) for known workarounds
- There may be a workaround for Chromium 61 to handle issues with GPU-based JS libraries

Would you like me to search for more specific workarounds or solutions for this issue?


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on my search, I found several results related to Premiere Pro slider issues. Here's a summary of the information:

## Premiere Pro Effect Controls Slider Issues and Fixes

The search results show this is a common issue where the ability to use the mouse slider to change things like position, scale, opacity, etc. in Effect Controls stops working, meaning the only way to change them is by typing new values in.

### Common Fixes:

1. **Update Premiere Pro**: The most recent updates have fixed the issue for some users. Make sure your software is fully updated.

2. **Windows Mouse Settings Fix**: On Windows, go to Mouse settings, select Additional Mouse Settings, go to Pointer Options tab, and change "Select a pointer speed" to the 7th notch. Optionally, deselect "Enhance pointer precision".

3. **Restart Computer**: Restarting the machine fixed it for some users.

4. **Reset Preferences**: Restart computer and hold down Shift + Alt while opening Premiere to reset preferences.

5. **Create New Project**: Opening a brand new project in Adobe Premiere Pro and then copying and pasting all the material and sequences into a new project helped, as the problem was related to opening a project from an earlier version.

6. **Wacom Tablet Issues**: Some users found that the mouse works for changing values but the Wacom tablet does not.(no content)You may want to try installing an earlier driver for your tablet, as it is sometimes problematic in Premiere to be using the latest Wacom driver.

7. **Mac Users**: Updating Premiere Pro and then restarting the Mac worked for some users.

### Additional Notes:
- Some users found that holding the left mouse button down and scrubbing rapidly left and right over the numbers eventually makes them move.
- This problem has persisted for some users even after trying everything including calling Adobe support.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"CSS Custom Range Slider","url":"https://codepen.io/brandonmcconnell/pen/oJBVQW"},{"title":"How To Create Range Sliders","url":"https://www.w3schools.com/howto/howto_js_rangeslider.asp"},{"title":"Styling Cross-Browser Compatible Range Inputs with CSS | CSS-Tricks","url":"https://css-tricks.com/styling-cross-browser-compatible-range-inputs-css/"},{"title":"Creating a custom CSS range slider with JavaScript upgrades - LogRocket Blog","url":"https://blog.logrocket.com/creating-custom-css-range-slider-javascript-upgrades/"},{"title":"How to Create a Custom Range Slider Using CSS — SitePoint","url":"https://www.sitepoint.com/css-custom-range-slider/"},{"title":"CSS Input Range: Simple Ways to Style Your Sliders","url":"https://www.dhiwise.com/blog/design-converter/css-input-range-how-to-customize-sliders-easily"},{"title":"Custom Input Range Slider","url":"https://codepen.io/solygambas/pen/WNGBrjZ"},{"title":"Custom input range: CSS","url":"https://codepen.io/ibaslogic/pen/KKBLMxy"},{"title":"Multi Range input, CSS-only","url":"https://codepen.io/vsync/pen/mdEJMLv"},{"title":"Custom range input slider with labels","url":"https://codepen.io/trevanhetzel/pen/rOVrGK"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about custom CSS range input sliders and workarounds:

## Custom CSS Range Slider Techniques

### Key Challenges
"Adding a slider widget to a webpage can be trickier than you might think. Sure, you can simply use an `<input />` element of type range, but styling it consistently across different browsers can be a real headache."(no content)This is because the range element is implemented as a web component. Browsers internally encapsulate and hide elements and styles that make up the input slider inside a shadow DOM.

### CSS Workarounds

**1. Reset Default Appearance:**
The base styles require `-webkit-appearance: none;` to hide the slider so that a custom slider can be made, and `background: transparent;` otherwise it shows white in Chrome.

**2. Vendor-Specific Pseudo-Elements:**
To customize the range slider for WebKit and Blink-based browsers (Safari, Chrome, Opera, Edge), use the `::-webkit-slider-runnable-track` pseudo-element to target the slider track and the `::-webkit-slider-thumb` pseudo-element to target the thumb. For Mozilla Firefox, use the `::-moz-range-track` pseudo-element to target the track and `::-moz-range-thumb` for the thumb.

**3. Progress Fill Trick with box-shadow:**
A common CSS-only technique uses `overflow: hidden` on the input and a large box-shadow on the thumb (e.g., `box-shadow: -407px 0 0 400px #f50;`) to create a slider progress effect.

**4. Border-Image Technique:**
The SitePoint tutorial demonstrates how to create a custom range slider using CSS and the native HTML element, without compromising accessibility or relying on JavaScript. The technique includes customizing the input element by resetting browser default styles, styling the thumb, and using border-image to create a sliding gradient effect.

### CEP Panel Specific Notes

The search didn't return results specific to Adobe CEP (Common Extensibility Platform) panels. CEP panels use an embedded Chromium browser, so WebKit-based CSS styling (`::-webkit-*` prefixes) should work. If you're experiencing issues in CEP specifically, you may need to:

1. Ensure you're using `-webkit-appearance: none;` to reset defaults
2. Use only the WebKit pseudo-elements since CEP uses Chromium
3. Check if certain CSS features are restricted in your CEP version

Would you like me to search more specifically for Adobe CEP panel CSS limitations?

input.query: "CEP" OR "UXP" slider drag issue pointer events CSS fix 2024

input.prompt: Extract the full discussion about range slider event listener issues and any solutions or workarounds provided. Include code examples.

content.content:
# Range Slider Event Listener Issues in UXP

## The Problem

A developer reported that standard HTML range sliders (`<input type="range">`) in Adobe's UXP environment "will only take input and change as event listeners and does not respond to other events like mousedown, mouseup etc."

## Solutions and Workarounds

**1. Use Spectrum Component**
The suggested alternative was to implement `sp-slider` instead of native HTML range inputs, as documented in Adobe's Spectrum UXP reference guide.

**2. Custom Slider Implementation**
A Adobe team member provided a sample implementation (FancySlider.jsx) demonstrating how to build custom sliders with full event support for developers requiring advanced functionality.

**3. Event Alternatives**
Rather than relying on mouse events, developers can utilize other events that fire on native range inputs, though this may require redesigning interaction patterns.

## Key Limitation

One developer noted that `sp-slider` "does not react to left/right arrow keys" unlike native `<input type="range">` elements, highlighting that alternative solutions come with their own constraints.

## Context

The discussion reflects broader frustration with UXP's event handling limitations compared to standard web APIs, with native controls offering significantly less event flexibility than custom HTML elements or Spectrum components.

**2. Custom Slider Implementation**

## Key Limitation

## Context

Troubleshooting `setAttribute` & `style.pointer-events` Issues","url":"https://www.xjavascript.com/blog/javascript-setting-pointer-events/"},{"title":"pointer-events - css","url":"https://webreference.com/css/properties/pointer-events/"},{"title":"pointer-events - Interactivity - Tailwind CSS","url":"https://tailwindcss.com/docs/pointer-events"},{"title":"pointer-events doesnt allow to set dragging item css properties like 'grab' or 'move' · Issue #15090 · angular/components","url":"https://github.com/angular/components/issues/15090"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found regarding CEP/UXP slider drag issues and pointer events CSS fixes:

## Key Findings

### UXP-Specific Information

Adobe has fixed a crash in sp-slider and fixed issues with dragging on sp-slider in past UXP updates for Adobe XD plugins.

There was a feature request on the Adobe Creative Cloud Developer Forums for CSS pointer-events: none support in UXP (from 2021).

### General CSS Pointer Events Solutions

The pointer-events CSS property can be used to disable pointer events (clicking, dragging, hovering, etc.) on elements.(no content)Microsoft's suggestion for handling drag issues is to set "touch-action" to either "pan-x" or "pan-y" — if it's set to "pan-y" then vertical swiping scrolls the page, while horizontal swiping fires events you can use for drag and drop.

### Troubleshooting Pointer Events

There could be a number of reasons why the CSS pointer-events property might not be working. Common things to check include: browser compatibility, validating the value, preventing keyboard events when pointer-events: none is set, checking if the parent has pointer-events: none, and checking for overriding rules.(no content)When using pointer-events: none, the element no longer responds to clicks, hover, touch, or drag events. Events intended for the element instead trigger on the nearest underlying element. Note that pointer-events does not inherit from parent to child.

### UXP CSS Improvements

UXP has received CSS/DOM event improvements in plugin UI, including support for text input color, img srcset, and online/offline events.

Would you like me to search for more specific information about CEP panel slider issues or a particular Adobe application (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.)?

input.query: CEP HTML panel slider range input cursor grab dragging CSS fix

input.prompt: Find all documented issues related to range sliders, input elements, dragging, pointer events, and any workarounds provided. Include code examples if available.

content.content:
# Issues Related to Input Elements and Pointer Events in CEP 11

Based on the documentation, here are the relevant issues:

## Drag Events Issue

**Issue 3: Drag events not fired while debugging**

The document states: "Drag events not fired while debugging an extension."

**Workaround provided:** Deactivate the screencast by selecting "Toggle device Toolbar" in the Chrome inspect window. Once disabled, drag operations function normally during debugging.

## Cross-Site iFrame UI Issues

**Issue 2: UI issues with cross-site iFrames**

Due to CEF's Site Isolation feature, cross-site iframes operate in separate renderer processes. This causes several interaction problems including:
- Tabbing functionality
- Hover states
- Keyboard shortcuts
- Clipboard operations
- `dispatchEvent` functionality

**Workaround:** Add the `--disable-site-isolation-trials` command line parameter to your manifest's `<CEFCommandLine>` section to disable Site Isolation. Note: Adobe cautions this may become unavailable in future CEF updates.

## No Range Slider or Input-Specific Issues

The documentation does not address range sliders, input elements, or pointer events specifically. The issues documented focus on iFrame cross-origin limitations and drag event debugging constraints.

toolUseResult.result:
# Issues Related to Input Elements and Pointer Events in CEP 11

Based on the documentation, here are the relevant issues:

## Drag Events Issue

**Issue 3: Drag events not fired while debugging**

The document states: "Drag events not fired while debugging an extension."

**Workaround provided:** Deactivate the screencast by selecting "Toggle device Toolbar" in the Chrome inspect window. Once disabled, drag operations function normally during debugging.

## Cross-Site iFrame UI Issues

**Issue 2: UI issues with cross-site iFrames**

Due to CEF's Site Isolation feature, cross-site iframes operate in separate renderer processes. This causes several interaction problems including:
- Tabbing functionality
- Hover states
- Keyboard shortcuts
- Clipboard operations
- `dispatchEvent` functionality

**Workaround:** Add the `--disable-site-isolation-trials` command line parameter to your manifest's `<CEFCommandLine>` section to disable Site Isolation. Note: Adobe cautions this may become unavailable in future CEF updates.

## No Range Slider or Input-Specific Issues

The documentation does not address range sliders, input elements, or pointer events specifically. The issues documented focus on iFrame cross-origin limitations and drag event debugging constraints.

I found excellent information. Here's what I discovered about CEP HTML panel slider/range input cursor and dragging issues:

## Summary of Search Results

### Known CEP Slider Bug (Fixed in CEP 10)
"The ability to click and drag a slider is broken" was a known bug listed as CEP-1845 that was fixed in CEP 10. "Range Slider is broken" and "CEP-1845: The ability to click and drag a slider is broken" were documented issues in the CEP-Resources releases.

### CSS Cursor Issues with Windows Scaling
"I noticed today that css cursor changes happen to not work properly. After some debugging I found that it has to do with Windows Display Scaling." This was reported in CEP version 10.0 with After Effects 2022.

### General CSS Range Slider Styling Solutions
For styling range input sliders with proper cursor behavior, here are the key approaches found:

1. **Basic cursor styling for the thumb:**
The thumb can use `cursor: ew-resize` for the webkit slider thumb with appropriate appearance settings.

2. **Cross-browser styling requires vendor prefixes:**
"Note that while we're repeating code here, that's necessary as you can't comma-separate these type of selectors. Browsers will drop the entire selector if it doesn't understand a part of it."

3. **For grab cursor during dragging**, one approach from the Angular components issue:
"Your cursor goes back to the default because the style is only on the thumb. You can either add a class to body when dragging or set the style directly using typescript."

4. **Recommended CSS approach:**
Use `-webkit-appearance: none; appearance: none; background: transparent; cursor: pointer;` for the base range input styling.

### CEP-Specific Debugging Workaround
"Workaround: Deactivate the screencast by selecting the 'Toggle device Toolbar' in the chrome inspect window. Once done, Drag operation can be performed even while debugging the extension."

### Resolution
If you're experiencing slider dragging issues in CEP panels:
1. **Upgrade to CEP 10 or later** - the slider dragging bug was fixed in CEP 10
2. **Check Windows display scaling** - cursor issues can occur when scaling is not 100%
3. **Apply proper CSS with vendor prefixes** for custom slider styling
4. **When debugging**, toggle off the device toolbar in Chrome DevTools


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on my search results, I found relevant information about Adobe CEP range slider issues:

## Adobe CEP Range Slider Issues

The search results reveal that "Range Slider is broken" is a known issue in Adobe CEP. More specifically, "the ability to click and drag a slider is broken" was documented as bug CEP-1845.

### Key Findings:

1. **Known CEP Bug**: This was a tracked issue (CEP-1845) that was addressed in CEP updates.

2. **CEP Architecture**: "CEP HTML engine is based on Chromium Embedded Framework version 3 (CEF3)." This means the range slider behavior depends on the underlying Chromium version.

3. **CEP 11 Updates**: "CEP 11 contains a major CEF update (Chromium Embedded Framework), from v74 to v88 and a major Node.js update from v9 to Node.js v15.9.0."

4. **JavaScript Library Compatibility**: "As long as a library can be used in CEF Client or Chrome browser, it should be usable in CEP HTML Engine."

### Potential Workarounds:

Based on CSS-Tricks guidance for custom range inputs, one approach is to:
- "Make the standard range input invisible to the user. It will still function normally and will be just as accessible but its appearance will be replaced by our own styled divs."
- "Event listeners are added to respond to both input and change events on the range inputs. They trigger the updateSlider function which receives a parameter representing the slider number and a second parameter representing the value chosen in the range element."

If you're experiencing the thumb jump/position issue in Adobe CEP, consider:
1. Updating to the latest CEP version where CEP-1845 was fixed
2. Implementing a custom slider using JavaScript event handlers
3. Using a third-party slider library that's compatible with CEF/Chrome


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.
